model.interfaces

Interface IWeeklyTime

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    WeeklyTime

    public interface IWeeklyTime
extends java.io.Serializable
    Interface that defines the complete timetable IClassrooomsDailyTime of an academic week, namely it represents the complete timetable of a semester of the faculty of informatics science and technology in Cesena.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • add

        void add(ISubject sub,
         Days d,
         Classrooms room,
         int hour,
         int n)
        It adds a course in the timetable of a classroom at the selected time of a specified day.
        Parameters:
        sub - Course to be added in the timetable.
        d - Day in which the course must be added.
        room - Classroom in which the course will be given.
        hour - Course starting time.
        n - Number of consecutive hours in which the course is given.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if d is null or in the cases that are specified in the method IClassroomsDailyTime.add(ISubject, Classrooms, int, int).

      • remove

        void remove(Days d,
            Classrooms room,
            int hour,
            int n)
        It removes from the timetable every course in a classroom in the selected hour of a specified day.
        Parameters:
        d - Day in which a course is deleted.
        room - Classroom in which a course is deleted.
        hour - Hour in which starting to delete.
        n - Number of consecutive hours that must be deleted.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if d is null or in the cases that are specified in the method IClassroomsDailyTime.remove(Classrooms, int, int).

      • getSubject

        java.util.Optional<ISubject> getSubject(Days d,
                                        Classrooms room,
                                        int hour)
        It gives back the course given in a specified hour in a classroom in a specified day.
        Parameters:
        d - Day in which looking for the course to be given back.
        room - Classroom in which looking for the course to be given back.
        hour - Hour in which looking for the course to be given back.
        Returns:
        The course given at the time, in the classroom and in the day that are specified. It is used an Optional to avoid giving back null Optional in case in which there are no courses in the selected hour.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if d is null or in the cases that are specified in the following method IClassroomsDailyTime.getSubject(Classrooms, int).

      • getClassroomDailyTime

        IClassroomsDailyTime getClassroomDailyTime(Days d)
        It gives back a copy of the daily timetable of all the classrooms IClassroomsDailyTime of a specific day.
        Parameters:
        d - Day of which we want to have the complete daily timetable.
        Returns:
        Complete daily timetable of all the classrooms.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if d is null.

      • copy

        IWeeklyTime copy()
        It creates a copy of itself, in order to respect the method #equals(Object).
        Returns:
        A copy of the object that call this method.

      • whereTeaching

        java.util.Set<Classrooms> whereTeaching(java.lang.String teach,
                                        Days d,
                                        int hour)
        It gives back a set containing in what classrooms is the specified teacher in a specified hour of the specified day.
        Parameters:
        teach - Name of the teacher of which we want to know where he gives lesson.
        d - Day in which looking for.
        hour - Hour in which looking for between all different hours.
        Returns:
        Set containing classrooms or empty set in the case that the course is not in the specified hour or if teach is null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if d is null.

      • wherePerforming

        java.util.Set<Classrooms> wherePerforming(ISubject sub,
                                          Days d,
                                          int hour)
        It gives back a set containing in what classrooms is the specified course in a specified hour of the specified day.
        Parameters:
        sub - Subject of which we want to know where it is in a specified hour.
        d - Day in which looking for.
        hour - Hour in which looking for between all classrooms.
        Returns:
        Set containing classrooms or empty set in the case that the course is not in the specified hour or if teach is null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if d is null.
